segments.en: Linked Discourses 55
3. About Sarakāni
30. With Nandaka the Licchavi

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

segments.pli: Atha kho nandako licchavimahāmatto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho nandakaṃ licchavimahāmattaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Nandaka the Licchavi minister went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

segments.pli: “Catūhi kho, nandaka, dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo.
segments.en: “Nandaka, a noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
What four?

segments.pli: Idha, nandaka, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

segments.en: the teaching …
the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi … pe … samādhisaṃvattanikehi.
segments.en: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, nandaka, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo.
segments.en: A noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.

segments.pli: Imehi ca pana, nandaka, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako āyunā saṃyutto hoti dibbenapi mānusenapi;
segments.en: A noble disciple who has these four things is guaranteed long life,
beauty,
happiness,
fame,
and sovereignty, both human and divine.

segments.pli: Taṃ kho panāhaṃ, nandaka, nāññassa samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā sutvā vadāmi. Api ca yadeva mayā sāmaṃ ñātaṃ sāmaṃ diṭṭhaṃ sāmaṃ viditaṃ, tadevāhaṃ vadāmī”ti.
segments.en: Now, I don’t say this because I’ve heard it from some other ascetic or brahmin. I only say it because I’ve known, seen, and realized it for myself.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro puriso nandakaṃ licchavimahāmattaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he had spoken, a certain person said to Nandaka:
“Sir, it is time to bathe.”
“Enough now, my man, with that exterior bath.
This interior bathing will do for me, that is,
confidence in the Buddha.”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī,…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha teaches the four factors of stream-entry to Nandaka, the minister of the Licchavis. When his servant tells him it is time for his ritual bath, he says that the inner bathing of the Dhamma is enough.
